alert.note: Alert for Weber (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 26 at 11:25AM MDT until May 29 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Utah... South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville affecting Weber County. .Warm temperatures and upstream dam releases will continue to result in high river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flows just below flood stage will continue. * WHERE...South Fork of The Ogden River Near Huntsville. * WHEN...Until early Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 4.6 feet (992 CFS), low lying areas near the banks of the South Fork of the Ogden River below Causey Reservoir through the town of Huntsville will receive minor flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM MDT Friday the stage was 4.4 feet (884 cfs). - Forecast...The river is expected to remain near action stage of 4.4 ft (900 cfs) through Saturday May 27 then slowly fall during the next several days. - Flood stage is 4.6 feet (992 cfs). &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 1200 PM MDT.
